newsitem.title: IRAN: Iran allocates $5.4 million to quake victims. [CORRECTED 13:10 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Iran allocates $5.4 million to quake victims. [CORRECTED 13:10 GMT]

text.p: Iran has allocated 16.2 billion (corrects from million) rials ($5.4 million) for the reconstruction of quake-stricken parts of the eastern region of Birjand, the official Iranian news agency IRNA reported on Sunday.
Mohammad Moradian, head of Birjand housing foundation, was quoted as saying the money would be paid in two instalments to 1,520 families living in 18 villages in the area.
Birjand was hit by a force 7.1 earthquake in May that killed 1,560 people, injured 2,600 and levelled 168 villages.
So far 1,030 families had received loans to rebuild their ruined houses, Moradian said.
He said more than 7,000 houses in 94 villages were destroyed in the earthquake and 2,750 of them were expected to be rebuilt by the end of the current Iranian year next March.
